Dear Senior Class,

Regrettably, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Passport Academy Charter School (PACS) is forced to announce the postponement of its graduation ceremony, originally scheduled for June 5, 2020. The school waited as long as we could to see if there was any way to keep the original graduation date.

You will still be OFFICIAL GRADUATES of PACS as of June 5th. And we are dedicated to the idea of holding an in-person graduation to celebrate the accomplishments of our seniors. As of today, our graduation date has been tentatively changed to July 2, 2020 at 6 P.M. at Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall on the University of Pittsburgh Campus in Oakland. Please note this graduation date is subject to further change based on the continued guidelines set forth by Governor Wolf and the Pennsylvania State Department of Education.

As a back-up plan, PACS has begun planning for a virtual graduation if we are unable to proceed with an in-person one. One way or another, we will keep our promise to you and celebrate the accomplishments of the PACS Class of 2020.

Mr. Jackson

Dear Senior Class,

Regrettably, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Passport Academy Charter School (PACS) is forced to announce the postponement of its graduation ceremony, originally scheduled for June 5, 2020. The school waited as long as we could to see if there was any way to keep the original graduation date.

You will still be OFFICIAL GRADUATES of PACS as of June 5th. And we are dedicated to the idea of holding an in-person graduation to celebrate the accomplishments of our seniors. As of today, our graduation date has been tentatively changed to July 2, 2020 at 6 P.M. at Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall on the University of Pittsburgh Campus in Oakland. Please note this graduation date is subject to further change based on the continued guidelines set forth by Governor Wolf and the Pennsylvania State Department of Education.

As a back-up plan, PACS has begun planning for a virtual graduation if we are unable to proceed with an in-person one. One way or another, we will keep our promise to you and celebrate the accomplishments of the PACS Class of 2020.

Mr. Jackson

Greetings,

Yesterday there was an incident that occurred at a neighboring school. Unfortunately, a couple of our students were involved. At no time during this incident were the safety of our students in danger.

Every incidence that occurs with our students inside and outside of school we take seriously and reminds us of the importance of safety and security.

We want to assure our families and the community that our school is evaluating and updating our school safety plan. We continually learn and evaluate best practices to ensure the safety of our staff and students.

We appreciate your support as we work together as a community to maintain a safe environment. The safety of our students and staff is and will remain our highest priority. We take pride in our school and students despite mistakes that they may make. We are excited to be in our new location and look forward to showcasing our successes.

Mr. Jackson
Principal

7. PACS Guidance team helps with Jobs, Daycare, College and Trade School Readies
8. All qualified PACS Students receive a Bus pass
9. PACS Graduates are now in the military, Trade School, 4 years and 2 years Colleges, along with the work place
10. PACS participates in the PGH Promise Program
